first state to ban electronic cigarettes. Assemblywoman Linda Rosenthal of Manhattan says e-cigarettes need to be studied first, and currently carry no warning labels. She's concerned about the nicotine in the vapor-emitting e-cigs, and also that most are made in China and other countries where the safety of products isn't well regulated. However, Hollywood actress Katherine Heigl says that e-cigarettes are perfectly fine! She even smoked one during a David Letterman appearance last year( and got the host to take a few puffs as well).
